text: Chillicothe Commercial Historic District is a national historic district located at Chillicothe, Livingston County, Missouri. The district encompasses 24 contributing buildings in the central business district and surrounding residential area of Chillicothe. It developed between about 1889 and 1950, and includes representative examples of Queen Anne, Italianate, Beaux Arts, Mission Revival, and Art Deco style architecture. Notable buildings include the Scruby Brothers Building (1893), S. A. Stone Building (c. 1894), Dairy Creme Building (c. 1950), Strand Coffee Shop Building (1936), Strand Hotel and Garage (1925), Norman & Jarvis Funeral Home Building (c. 1916), Empire Theatre (1916), Chillicothe Post Office/Federal Building (1916), Grace & Simpson Apartments (1916), and Loomis Building/Chillicothe Post Office (1898). (includes 8 photographs) and Site map It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2002. ==References== Category:Historic districts on the National Register of Historic Places in Missouri Category:Queen Anne architecture in Missouri Category:Italianate architecture in Missouri Category:Mission Revival architecture in Missouri Category:Beaux-Arts architecture in Missouri Category:Art Deco architecture in Missouri Category:Buildings and structures in Livingston County, Missouri Category:National Register of Historic Places in Livingston County, Missouri
title: Chillicothe Commercial Historic District
